The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: As a long-standing TLOU fan\, I was severely disappointed by the delivery of this game.What I liked:In terms of the visual aspects\, they did an amazing job. The game is beautiful. The graphics and world building is captivating.The AI is exhilarating\, by using different weapons and tactics when confronted by your enemies.What I didn't like:There are big problems with the story\, the way it's told\, and the way it was delivered.I get that it was experimental and similar to the styling of some directors\, but it really didn't work for me.It's a simple revenge story and it's Vanilla at best.The game constantly forces you to like characters you have no relationship with. Introducing and killing them off almost feels like they didn't need to be there at all.I reckon Ellie's descent into chaos would have worked much better if they had kept Joel around for more than the 5 minutes of gameplay you get with him.Anyways\, the game got about half of it right and the other half is an absolute mess.This is not TLOU\, this is a hot mess and time wasted I will never get back. The biggest disappointment in gaming for me since No Man's Sky.… Expand
